intro: Justicia geniculata, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or pink tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its showy blooms attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds, making it a valuable addition to native gardens.
